record.darwin:Remarks: Keys to A. oetik/venosus in Kailula (1999 FAO Western Central Pacific Guide) but anal ray counts (15) are not in agreement with these species (ca.18). Gill rakers (16) are nob-like and occur both anteriorly and posteriorly on arch; tooth patches as illustrated for A. oetik (=utik) except interspace wider. P. Kailula (pers. comm.) guessed it could be A. jatius (of Hamilton, 1822) or A. sp. but unsure - Wayne C. Starnes, 2007.
